title: High-precision visual navigation device calibration method based on collimator
author: Shunkun Liang (National University of Defense Technology), Dongcai Tan (National University of Defense Technology), Banglei Guan (National University of Defense Technology), Zhang Li (National University of Defense Technology), Guangcheng Dai (National University of Defense Technology), Nianpeng Pan (National University of Defense Technology), Liang Shen (North Navigation Control Technology Co., Ltd), ..., Qifeng Yu (National University of Defense Technology)
relevance_why: The paper introduces novel calibration techniques using a collimator, which could enhance the reliability and precision of sensor systems applicable to audio localization and environmental modeling in audio-visual integration.
background: The study focuses on precise calibration methods for visual navigation devices, essential for accurate localization and navigation in various autonomous technologies.
contribution: This paper introduces a collimator-based calibration method to solve the inefficiencies in traditional camera and attitude calibration processes, achieving comparable accuracy and stability to existing multi-image techniques.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional calibration methods require multiple images from various angles, making them complex and time-consuming.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon these methods by using a single-image calibration approach, significantly reducing calibration time while maintaining accuracy.

key_innovation: The integration of a collimator and a specially designed calibration frame enables fast and precise calibration of both camera parameters and attitude.
real_world_impact: This calibration method has potential applications in the fields of robotics, UAVs, and autonomous driving systems, promoting improvements in navigation accuracy and operational efficacy.
limitations: The study did not address potential challenges of real-world environmental conditions affecting calibration precision.

new_terms.collimator: **Collimator** is an optical device that narrows a beam of particles or waves, and in this context, it is used to provide stable and uniform calibration targets.
new_terms.re-projection error: **Re-projection error** is a measure of accuracy used in computer vision, indicating the difference between the projected and the actual image points, used for assessing calibration quality.
